meaning: To chew (the cud), as a cow does.
To turn (something) over in the mind; meditate (on)
To reflect on over and over again.
(botany) Having a hard albumen penetrated by irregular channels filled with softer matter, as the nutmeg and the seeds of the North American papaw.
sentences: Gently accept it; you cannot change it, and the more you ruminate over it, the worse it will make you feel.
A moon that falls in Scorpio has the tendency to brood and ruminate, but it also gives much strength, determination and perseverance to the individual.
Do not ruminate anywhere except in your chosen spot.
As the afternoon dwindled, the Deans were content to rock and ruminate.
Farmers today sometimes still ruminate on these ideas after a few drinks down pub.
Accordingly, Rumsfeld would be without an audience if he chose to ruminate on the subject among this group.
Though these animals ruminate, the stomach differs considerably in the details of its construction from that of the Pecora.
